channel.title: [Weird Compiler help Needed] Proximity pk [PI 317]
channel.description:
Hello there, unfortunately, I am getting a compiler error, I have tried fixing it, but, honestly, I've had no luck fixing it. This is most likely easy for you guys out there. I barely have experience anymore, since I gave up for a while. I hope someone can help me. Thanks.
Compiler error; [CODE] src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:210: error: cannot find symbol ignores[Integer.parseInt(token3[ 0])] = Long.parseLong(token3[1]); ^ symbol: variable ignores location: class PlayerSave Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . . [/CODE]
And here's the line it's pointing out too... [CODE] case 9: if (token.equals("character-ignore")) { >>> This here> ignores[Integer.parseInt(token3[0])] = Long.parseLong(token3[1]); } break; [/CODE] Any and every help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: [Weird Compiler help Needed] Proximity pk [PI 317]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’ve personally only used Netbeans and Eclipse.

Netbeans has a couple bells and whistles, but over all I like the UI of Eclipse.

Though, the complexity of generally any IDE is going to “scare” a first time user.

You should look into some beginner guides for whichever you pick.

Most of the RSPS community uses Eclipse, so they have a lot of guides specifically tailored to Eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: [Weird Compiler help Needed] Proximity pk [PI 317]
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:549965”][quote author=malimt link=topic=668845.msg4473677#msg4473677 date=1424547425]

Use an IDE.

It’ll (basically) fix it for you by giving you a suggestion on what to do.

Eclipse? Or something else that you know of?
[/quote]
Eclipse
Netbeans
Codenvy
DrJava

Seriously whichever one you want.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_integrated_development_environments#Java[/quote]
Thank you very much for that.
I was also wondering, which would be the best for beginners, first time users?

Read full topic

item.title: [Weird Compiler help Needed] Proximity pk [PI 317]
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:549965”]You’d create it just like any other array of variables…
Tbh, there’s literally no reason to explain this because of how basic it is…

^That’s basically it…
You should have almost this exact same code, but with the word “friends” instead of ignores.
It’ll be in the player class.[/quote]
I tried that multiple times and I asked for help from others, but had no luck.
Is there anything else that I could possibly do?
Here’s the current error I am getting.

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:210: error: cannot find symbol p.ignores[Integer.parseInt(token 3[0])] = Long.parseLong(token3[1]); ^ symbol: variable ignores location: variable p of type Client Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [Weird Compiler help Needed] Proximity pk [PI 317]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’d create it just like any other array of variables…
Tbh, there’s literally no reason to explain this because of how basic it is…

^That’s basically it…
You should have almost this exact same code, but with the word “friends” instead of ignores.
It’ll be in the player class.

Read full topic

item.title: [Weird Compiler help Needed] Proximity pk [PI 317]
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:549965”][quote author=malimt link=topic=668845.msg4473035#msg4473035 date=1424200181]

You forgot to put the player object before the ignore…

change it to “p.ignores”

I have tried that, it didn’t work.
That’s mainly why I was so confused.
[/quote]
Then perhaps the variable doesn’t exist.
Have you tried creating it in the player class?
It’s an array of longs.[/quote]
Nope, I have never tried to create it.
How would I do that, if I wanted too?
Any tips for me?
Thank you very much.

Read full topic

item.title: [Weird Compiler help Needed] Proximity pk [PI 317]
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

Hello there,
unfortunately, I am getting a compiler error, I have tried fixing it, but, honestly, I’ve had no luck fixing it.
This is most likely easy for you guys out there. I barely have experience anymore, since I gave up for a while.
I hope someone can help me.
Thanks.

Compiler error;

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:210: error: cannot find symbol ignores[Integer.parseInt(token3[ 0])] = Long.parseLong(token3[1]); ^ symbol: variable ignores location: class PlayerSave Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

And here’s the line it’s pointing out too…

[CODE]
case 9:
if (token.equals(“character-ignore”)) {

This here> ignores[Integer.parseInt(token3[0])] = Long.parseLong(token3[1]);
}
break;
[/CODE]
Any and every help is greatly appreciated.

Read full topic
